meanings.definition: A person or thing that hisses.
meanings.sent1: The audience was startled by the loud hissers during the play.
meanings.sent2: I saw some hissers in the grass while walking in the park.
meanings.sent3: The hissers in the kitchen were just the leaking pipes making noise.
meanings.sent4: The hissers in the audience made the speaker nervous.
meanings.sent5: The hissers in the bushes turned out to be just a group of cats.

meanings.sent1: My little brother is scared of hissers, especially the big ones.
meanings.sent2: We learned about different hissers in our science class.
meanings.sent3: The hissers in the zoo always attract a lot of visitors.
meanings.sent4: The hissers in the garden seemed to be enjoying the sun.
meanings.sent5: The hissers in the pet store were colorful and fascinating.

meanings.definition: A derogatory term for someone who betrays or informs on others.
meanings.sent1: Nobody wants to be friends with a hissers who can't keep a secret.
meanings.sent2: The group found out there was a hissers among them.
meanings.sent3: The hissers at school always tried to get others in trouble.
meanings.sent4: The hissers in the movie turned out to be the unexpected villain.
meanings.sent5: The hissers in the office was eventually exposed and faced consequences.
